triples.name: Second-language acquisition
triples.relevance: The paper models how phonetic systems reorganize during L2 learning in response to L2 input

triples.name: Language acquisition
triples.relevance: The SLM-r proposes that mechanisms for native language acquisition remain accessible for L2 learning across the lifespan

triples.name: Phonetics
triples.relevance: The paper focuses on phonetic categories, phonetic systems, and phonetic dissimilarity in L2 sound learning

triples.name: Phonological development
triples.relevance: The SLM-r explains how phonetic categories develop and reorganize across the lifespan in both L1 and L2

triples.name: Speech perception
triples.relevance: Perceiving phonetic dissimilarity of L2 sounds is central to formation of new phonetic categories in the model

triples.name: Statistical learning in language acquisition
triples.relevance: The SLM-r proposes that L1/L2 categories are updated when statistical properties of input distributions change

triples.name: Individual variation in second-language acquisition
triples.relevance: The SLM-r is explicitly an individual differences model that accounts for variation in L2 phonetic learning

triples.name: Theories of second-language acquisition
triples.relevance: The paper presents the revised SLM-r as a new theoretical framework for understanding L1-L2 phonetic category interaction within SLA theory
